Description: Foot and wall fragment of a North Ionian pottery rosette bowl; exterior: black bands; interior: black and added red paint; in reserved tondo: five-pointed star with solid rays around a central dot; black zone around tondo with thin band of added red paint; top of foot and lower part of bowl are black; underside of foot reserved with black band around edge. Foot is a solid disk with squared edges, slightly concave on the underside with a small central indentation.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Marked in ink on base: "Naukrats. G. J. Chester. 1885".
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. 1, 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.823)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
